DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Topical R333 Patients With Discoid Lupus Erythematosus ( DLE ) Systemic Lupus Erythematosus ( SLE ) Lesions
DOC.detailed_description: This Phase 2 , multi-center , randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled study evaluate preliminary efficacy , safety , tolerability , pharmacokinetics topical R333 ointment formulate 6 % ( 60 mg/g ) DLE SLE patient active discoid lesion .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis SLE DLE ( DLE confirm histologically prior randomization ) . At least 2 active discoid lesion secondary SLE DLE prior study entry , minimum Erythema Rating Score ≥ 2 . At least 1 active discoid lesion must present ( history ) ≥ 3 week prior screen . Patients take azathioprine , hydroxychloroquine , chloroquine , quinacrine , methotrexate , and/ oral glucocorticoid , must receive stable daily dose ≥ 4 week prior randomization must remain dose throughout study . Azathioprine , hydroxychloroquine , chloroquine , quinacrine , methotrexate must initiate ≥ 8 week prior randomization . Congenital acquire immunodeficiency include : HIV infection , agammaglobulinemia , T cell deficiency HTLV1 infection time prior study . Lymphoproliferative disease previous total lymphoid irradiation . Uncontrolled poorly control hypertension . History psoriasis , eczema , relevant atopy . Exposure excessive chronic UV radiation ( e.g. , tan bed , sunbathe , solarium , phototherapy ) within 2 week prior randomization study period .
